===Deadpool's Team===
This group of mercenaries gathered together by [[Wade Wilson (Earth-616)|Deadpool]] was originally named [[Heroes for Hire]].{{r|Deadpool Vol 6 1}} Deadpool was inspired to create a franchise around his identity after [[James Bourne (Earth-616)|Solo]] impersonated him, and piggybacked on the merc's success to take jobs at Deadpool's pay rate. Solo's impersonation helped Deadpool become more popular, thus benefiting both mercs.{{r|Deadpool Vol 6 7}}

After turning Solo into his first employee, Deadpool began to recruit other vigilantes, who would initially wear costumes identical to his.{{r|Deadpool Vol 6 1}} Following a cease and desist letter from [[Luke Cage (Earth-616)|Luke Cage]], the leader of the original and defunct [[Heroes for Hire (Power Man & Iron Fist) (Earth-616)|Heroes for Hire]],{{r|Deadpool Vol 6 2}} Deadpool's team was legally forced to change their name, and they chose "Mercs for Money."{{r|Deadpool Vol 6 3}} Around this time, the Mercs for Money began to use color-coded costumes to distinguish each other from an independent Deadpool impersonator who was ruining the real one's reputation.{{r|Deadpool Vol 6 4}} This evil impersonator ended up being revealed as [[Madcap (Earth-616)|Madcap]], who was also a member of the Mercs for Money.{{r|Deadpool Vol 6 5}} Once they got rid of Madcap, the Mercs for Money began using their own personal uniforms.{{r|Deadpool & the Mercs for Money Vol 1 1}}

[[File:Deadpool & the Mercs for Money Vol 2 1 Textless.jpg|thumb|left|Original line-up]]
The Mercs for Money eventually became disgruntled by Deadpool, from the way he treated them to the delays in their paychecks.{{r|Deadpool Vol 6 14}} When they set out to create their own business, the Mercs discovered Deadpool had been skimming from them.{{r|Deadpool Vol 6 15}} After retrieving and burning their contracts from a safety deposit in [[Ho-Ho-Kus]], [[New Jersey (State)|New Jersey]], the Mercs and Deadpool parted ways.{{r|Deadpool Vol 6 17}}

===Domino's Team===
In order to help Deadpool rescue [[Ellie Phimister (Earth-616)|Negasonic Teenage Warhead]] from [[Umbral Dynamics (Earth-616)|Umbral Dynamics]], [[Neena Thurman (Earth-616)|Domino]] assembled a new team of Mercs of Money, composed of herself, [[Masacre (Earth-616)|Masacre]], [[Aaron Stack (Impostor) (Earth-616)|Machine Man]] and [[Kenneth Hale (Earth-616)|Gorilla Man]].{{r|Deadpool & the Mercs for Money Vol 2 4}}

| Equipment               = '''[[Deadpool's Suit]]''' and '''[[Stingray's Suit]]'''
